descrPortal.name: Theater directors of Belarus
descrPortal.description: A theatre director or stage director is an instructor in the theatre fiel who oversees and orchestrates the mounting of a theatre production (a play, opera, musical, or devised piece of work) by unifying various endeavours and aspects of production. The director's function is to ensure the quality and completeness of theatre production and to lead the members of the creative team into realizing their artistic vision for it. The director thereby collaborates with a team of creative individuals and other staff, coordinating research, stagecraft, costume design, props, lighting design, acting, set design, stage combat, and sound design for the production. If the production is a new piece of writing or a (new) translation of a play, the director may also work with the playwright or a translator.

director1.name: Evstigney
director1.generalInfo: Russian and Belarusian Soviet actor, director, playwright, teacher, professor (1945). People's Artist of the Byelorussian SSR (1940).

biography.content: He began his professional stage career in 1900 in St. Petersburg as an actor and director. He played in the Admiralty, Catherine, Kronstadt theaters, since 1910 in the miniature theaters: Troitsky, Intimate, Liteiny.
He began to work in theaters of Belarus. Artistic Director of the Belarusian State Drama Theater in Minsk.
Artistic Director of the Belarusian Theater of Young Spectators named after N. Krupskaya.
Director of the 1st Belarusian State Drama Theater in Minsk (now the Yanka Kupala National Academic Theater).

Artistic director and head of the department of skill of the actor of the Belarusian Theater and Art Institute. Professor. He was also engaged in teaching at theatrical studios, at the Minsk Theater School.

placesOfActivity.activity: 1st Belarusian State Drama Theater in Minsk (now - Yanka Kupala National Academic Theater)

director2.name: Larisa
director2.generalInfo: Belarusian, Soviet opera singer (soprano), director, publicist, public figure. People's Artist of the USSR (1940).

biography.content: She studied at the Minsk College of Music, in 1928 - in a special opera class.

Soloist of the Belarusian Opera and Ballet Theater in Minsk. She performed both soprano and mezzo-soprano parts. During the war, she gave concerts at the fronts, in hospitals and in partisan detachments.
She was also the chief director of the Belarusian Opera and Ballet Theater. In the year she managed to release two premiere performances.
The initiator of the creation and the permanent chairman of the board of the Belarusian Theater Society.

director3.name: Boris
director3.generalInfo: Soviet and Belarusian film and theater director. People's Artist of the Republic of Belarus (1995). Honored Art Worker of the Byelorussian SSR (1975).

biography.content: He graduated from the Belarusian State Theater and Art Institute (course of V.A. Malankin, Honored Art Worker of the Belarusian SSR).
He worked as a director of the Y. Kupala National Academic Theater.
He worked as the main director of the State Russian Drama Theater of the Belarusian SSR.
Artistic director and then director of the National Gorky Academic Drama Theater.

listOfWorks.work: V. Bykov «To Go and not Return»
Y. Kupala «The Dream on the Barrow»

placesOfActivity.activity: National Academic Drama Theater named after M. Gorky

director.name: Ignat
director.birthPlace: Manor of Polivachi of the Prozorok volost (Glubokoe district of Vitebsk region)
director.generalInfo: Belarusian actor, director, theater figure, founder of the first professional national Belarusian theater.

biography.content: Together with his daughters Wanda and Elena, as well as with their close friends, he created an amateur troupe in the Polivachi folklore. The feature of the performances was that the Belarusian language sounded from the stage, folk dances familiar to ordinary people were performed.
On its basis, a permanent group was formed and long tours around Belarus began.
Buinitsky organized the Prozorok Belarusian Credit Society, in which every peasant could get a loan at a small percentage.
Buinitsky took an active part in the activities of the Vilna society «To Help the Front».
Was one of the initiators of the creation of the “First Partnership of Belarusian Drama and Comedy” in Minsk, on the basis of which the Yanka Kupala National Academic Theater arose.
He went to the Western Front of the First World War.s

director.name: Leoon
director.birthPlace: Terechovka, Gomel County, Mogilev Province, Russian Empire
director.generalInfo: Gomel County, Mogilev Province, Russian Empire, Soviet actor, director, teacher. People's Artist of the USSR (1966).

biography.content: He studied at the Leningrad College of Performing Arts (student L.S. Vivien and S.E. Radlov).
Artist and assistant director of the Leningrad Worker Theater Proletkult.
Artistic Director of the Theater Workshop of the Kiev Council of Trade Unions.
Actor and director (from 1935) (in 1938-1943 - head of the art department) of the Theater. Y. Kupala in Minsk. He began directing activities under the guidance of E. A. Mirovich.

director.name: Vladimit
director.generalInfo: Soviet actor and director, Honored Artist of the RSFSR (1945).

biography.content: Met with Nemirovich-Danchenko and began to work in his theater.
He graduated from the art school at the theater and was immediately accepted into the main troupe of the theater.
The actor of the Moscow Art Theater. In 1918 he organized an art studio in Odessa. Then he worked as a director at the Massodram Theater (Odessa).
made his only silent film in 4 parts «Headless woman».
The main director of the Moscow Regional Theater of Young Spectators.
Director-administrator of the Opera Studio K. S. Stanislavsky in Moscow. He directed the opera in Minsk and Tiflis. He was the first opera director and founder of the Belarusian opera.

placesOfActivity.activity: Moscow Academic Musical Theater of K. S. Stanislavsky and V. I. Nemirovich-Danchenko
